revision.text: Possibly: The State of the Printed Hebrew Text of the Old Testament considered. A Dissertation in Two Parts. Part the First compares IChron. XI with 2 Sam. V and XXIII ; and Part the Second contains Observations on Seventy Hebrew MSS, With an Extract of Mistakes and Various Readings. By Benjamin Kennicott, M. A. Fellow of Exeter College. (Oxford : Printed at the Theatre : and Sold by Mr. Clements and Mr. Fletcher ; London: Mr. Birt, Mess. Rivington and Mr. Dodsley ; Cambridge: Mr. Thurlbourn and Mr. Merril ; Bath: Mr. Leake ; Exeter: Mr. Score, MDCCLIII. [1753]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2393772~S1 Further information about "The Kennicott Bible" : http://bav.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/news/the-kennicott-bible Digitised edition of The Kennicott Bible in the Digital Bodleian: http://digital.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/inquire/p/b425fd81-ba95-4ddf-bafa-b304c22702eb
